comments: The dependency upon org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility was removed from org.org.eclipse.core.resources. This breaks our application since org.eclipse.ui.ide depends upon the compatibility plugin for the ResourceNavigator view. The dependency was broken due to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=162402.
If the IDE plugin requires runtime compatibility, it should specify this in its manifest.

A close look at the startup of the ResourceNavigator view shows that org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform is throwing the IllegalStateException. Maybe its org.eclipse.core.runtime that should specify it in its manifest.
John I'll pass it to you first...if you think it's a Navigator issue then pass it on to Michael Elder.
This doesn't seem to have anything to do with the Resources plug-in (and John is away for a while). Moving to Runtime for comment.
Can you please attach the log file with the errors?

I created an Eclipse Application run configuration, deselect all plugins, check org.eclipse.ui.ide, click add required plug-ins, run, show view "Navigator" which throws a java.lang.IllegalStateException (see stack trace below).

Adding the org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility plugin allows the "Navigator" view to work.

The Resource Navigator is calling deprecated code in Platform.

Platform#getPlugin (and Platform#getPluginRegistry) have been deprecated and the javadoc states that these methods can only be called if the runtime compatibility layer is installed.

Created an attachment (id=75032)
suggested patch to fix deprecations.

Uses "PlatformUI.getPreferenceStore()" instead of "Platform.getPlugin(PlatformUI.PLUGIN_ID).getPreferenceStore()" and removes old migrateDialogSettings code that is no longer required.

Created an attachment (id=75535)
patch 75032 + FiltersContentProvider

Also remove a deprecation in FitlersContentProvider.

I'll release this into 3.3.1 and 3.4M2 once M1 is finished.

PW
